_description: Home Insurance Sample Data - Use this template for creating homeowners insurance pages

data.intro_content: California homeowners face unique challenges including wildfire and earthquake risks. Average premiums are $1,200/year.
data.requirements_content: While not legally required, mortgage lenders mandate homeowners insurance. Standard HO-3 policies cover most perils except earthquakes and floods.

cost_factors.description: High fire zones see 50%+ higher rates
Higher rebuild costs mean higher premiums
Older homes may cost more to insure

faqs.question: Is earthquake coverage included?
faqs.answer: No, earthquake coverage requires a separate policy or endorsement in California.

faqs.question: What does standard home insurance cover?
faqs.answer: Standard HO-3 policies cover dwelling, personal property, liability, and additional living expenses.

data.intro_content: Florida has some of the highest home insurance rates due to hurricane risk. Miami homeowners pay an average of $2,400/year.
data.requirements_content: Florida homeowners need windstorm coverage for hurricane protection. Many areas also require flood insurance.

cost_factors.description: Flood insurance required in many areas

faqs.question: Is flood insurance required in Florida?
faqs.answer: Required in high-risk flood zones with mortgages. Recommended for all coastal areas.
